title: Photography in the digital age by Michael Stipe - in pictures
text: HTTP as Gateway Helmets, Studio, Athens HTTP stands for hypertext transfer protocol. I did a whole series around it. The HTTP is the gateway to any doorway that’s now opened through the internet. You have to go through this gateway. And so I decided to create these. Opposite this picture in my book is another version, a kind of Hindu Buddha version which uses the boxes for incense that’s the most common type of incense that’s imported into the US from India. This one is made with discarded crash helmets... They were all too easy to find. People give them away a lot. None of them are new. They’re all old. Then I put them on top of wood that came out of my back yard.’
description: Post-REM, Michael Stipe has settled into life as a visual artist. He talks us through some of the key images from his new photography book
